sub_topics.title: data structures
sub_topics.level_0: Doesn't know the difference between Array and LinkedList
sub_topics.level_1: Able to explain and use Arrays, LinkedLists, Dictionaries, etc, in practical programming tasks
sub_topics.level_2: Knows space and time tradeoffs of the basic data structures, Arrays vs LinkedLists, Able to explain how hashtables can be implemented and can handle collisions, Priority queues and ways to implement them etc.
sub_topics.level_3: Knowledge of advanced data structures like B-trees, binomial and fibonacci heaps, AVL/Red Black trees, Splay Trees, Skip Lists, tries etc.

sub_topics.title: algorithms
sub_topics.level_0: Unable to find the average of numbers in an array (It’s hard to believe but I’ve interviewed such candidates)
sub_topics.level_1: Basic sorting, searching and data structure traversal and retrieval algorithms
sub_topics.level_2: Tree, Graph, simple greedy and divide and conquer algorithms, is able to understand the relevance of the levels of this matrix.
sub_topics.level_3: Able to recognize and code dynamic programming solutions, good knowledge of graph algorithms, good knowledge of numerical computation algorithms, able to identify NP problems etc.

sub_topics.title: systems programming
sub_topics.level_0: Doesn’t know what a compiler, linker or interpreter is
sub_topics.level_1: Basic understanding of compilers, linker and interpreters. Understands what assembly code is and how things work at the hardware level. Some knowledge of virtual memory and paging.
sub_topics.level_2: Understands kernel mode vs. user mode, multi-threading, synchronization primitives and how they’re implemented, able to read assembly code. Understands how networks work, understanding of network protocols and socket level programming.
sub_topics.level_3: Understands the entire programming stack, hardware (CPU + Memory + Cache + Interrupts + microcode), binary code, assembly, static and dynamic linking, compilation, interpretation, JIT compilation, garbage collection, heap, stack, memory addressing...

sub_topics.title: source code and version control
sub_topics.level_2: Proficient in using CVS and SVN features. Knows how to branch and merge, use patches setup repository properties etc.
sub_topics.level_3: Knowledge of distributed VCS systems. Has tried out Bzr/Mercurial/Darcs/Git

sub_topics.title: build automation
sub_topics.level_0: Only knows how to build from IDE
sub_topics.level_1: Knows how to build the system from the command line
sub_topics.level_2: Can setup a script to build the basic system
sub_topics.level_3: Can setup a script to build the system and also documentation, installers, generate release notes and tag the code in source control

sub_topics.title: automated testing
sub_topics.level_0: Thinks that all testing is the job of the tester
sub_topics.level_1: Has written automated unit tests and comes up with good unit test cases for the code that is being written
sub_topics.level_2: Has written code in TDD manner
sub_topics.level_3: Understands and is able to setup automated functional, load/performance and UI tests
